conclusion: Analyze forces acting on the charged ball for equilibrium.
The image shows a small ball suspended by a string at an angle θ with mass m and charge q.
Identify forces: gravitational force (mg), tension force (T), and electric force (qE).
Resolve tension force T into vertical (T cos θ) and horizontal (T sin θ) components.
For equilibrium, sum of forces in vertical and horizontal directions must be zero.
Vertical equilibrium: T cos θ = mg.
Horizontal equilibrium: T sin θ = qE.
Solve for T: T = mg / cos θ.
Substitute T into horizontal equilibrium: (mg / cos θ) sin θ = qE.
Simplify to solve for E: mg tan θ = qE.
Isolate E: E = mg tan θ / q.
